thread.title: Man fighting for life in hospital following crash on M66 - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Man fighting for life in hospital following crash on M66 - Manchester Evening News

author: Alexandra Rucki
title: Man fighting for life in hospital following crash on M66 - Manchester Evening News
text:
News Man fighting for life in hospital following crash on M66 Emergency services were called to Northbound slip road near junction two of the motorway, Heywood, at about 7pm on Thursday Share The crash happened on the M66 (Photo: Steve Allen) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A man is fighting for his life in hospital following a collision on the M66. 
Emergency services were called to Northbound slip road near junction two of the motorway, Heywood , at about 7pm on Thursday. 
A silver Mercedes Benz was entering the carriageway when it broke down at the end of the slip road. 
The driver put the hazard lights on and waited for recovery. 
But while waiting the vehicle was involved in a collision with a Black Vauxhall Astra. Read More 
A 29-year-old woman and a 32-year-old man were taken to hospital in an ambulance. 
Police said the man remains in hospital in a serious condition. 
Road closures were put in place, but the motorway has now fully reopened. 
Police are appealing for witnesses of the collision to come forward. 
PC Anthony Pye of GMP’s Serious Collision Investigation Unit, said: “While our investigation continues, we have a man in hospital who is being treated for very serious injuries. Read More A6 Stockport Road closed after serious crash involving motorbike - latest updates 
“We need to fully understand how the cars came to be involved in a collision with one another and the events leading up to the collision. 
“I’m appealing to anyone who witnessed the collision, or to anyone who saw the vehicles prior to the collision, to get in contact with my team. 
“If you were in the area at that time and may have dashcam footage, we’d also like to hear from you.” 
Anyone with information should contact GMP’s Serious Collision Investigation Unit on 0161 856 4741 or the independent charity Crimestoppers, anonymously, on 0800 555 111. Like us on Facebook
